subject: Add generic GCC support for atomic operations
commitMessage:
Add generic GCC support for atomic operations

This is useful for architectures where no specialized code has been
written.

Written-by Chanho Park:
This patch is required for AArch64 build. Originally, this patch
resolved the issue "Issue 488:	powerpc-linux cross compilation not
compiling anymore"[1]. It also can be applied for aarch64 build.
I brought it from protobuf repository.[2]

[1] : https://code.google.com/p/protobuf/issues/detail?id=488
[2] :
https://code.google.com/p/protobuf/issues/attachmentText?id=488&aid=4880003000&name=0001-Add-generic-GCC-support-for-atomic-operations.patch&token=zafaULrC5F073rJM_PgX_NGA_y8%3A1369359048977

Change-Id: Ie95e4e05eaf98850a97ecd4c5f633bd5639bcb0c
Signed-off-by: Chanho Park <chanho61.park@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

if this change is coming from elsewhere you can add 

Origin: $URL 

to commit message

this will help maintainers tasks

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I am granted to merge it ,. just request me to ... a bug is better for tracking but it's ok if you use a gerrit comment

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Please merge this patch if you have any permission.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
